Metrics.ElementText:

Services offered include: 
• Assessment / Information

value.SummaryText:
Please ring to check the latest information regarding Covid Restrictions.

 

The Harbour is a new 154 bedded mental health hospital situated on Preston New Road (A583) just off junction 4 of the M55 at Blackpool. It is a no smoking building.

The hospital has single ensuite bedrooms of varying specialisms over 10 wards, the wards are defined as follows:

  • Churchill and Orwell – 2 Male acute mental health wards
  • Shakespeare and Stevenson – 2 Female acute mental health wards
  • Dickens - Male advanced care need ward
  • Austen - Female advanced care need ward
  • Wordsworth - Male dementia ward
  • Bronte - Female dementia ward
  • Keats - Male Psychiatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU)
  • Byron - Female Psychiatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU)

The functional acute mental health wards accommodate patients from the age of 18 experiencing an acute mental illness requiring inpatient care. This also includes dual diagnosis of mental illness as the primary diagnosis, with personality order, learning disability or drug and alcohol misuse.

The advanced care wards accommodate older patients who are experiencing an acute mental illness that are also physically frail or who are also experiencing physical disability or illness.

The dementia wards accommodate patients diagnosed with dementia who are requiring the relational and physical care and security that an inpatient ward can provide.

The PICU will provide an environment of a higher relational, physical and procedural security, in order to safely care and treat patients who are acutely unwell, posing a higher risk to themselves or others and requiring lower stimulating environment.

ParentOrganisation.OrganisationName: Lancashire & South Cumbria NHS Foundation Trust

ServiceProvider.OrganisationName: Lancashire & South Cumbria NHS Foundation Trust

Services.ServiceName: Mental Health - Adults of all ages
Services.ServiceDescription:
The Harbour is a new 154 bedded mental health hospital situated on Preston New Road (A583) just off junction 4 of the M55 at Blackpool. It is a no smoking building.

The hospital was designed with extensive input from service users and clinicians and is based on good practice guidance and 'safety by design' to ensure that it can provide high quality care. The ethos of the unit is to provide therapeutic care which is empowering, person centered and needs led, and focuses on promoting recovery and independence.

Services.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
LCAS provides a city wide service for residents of Liverpool. We work in the acute hospitals and community bases providing support and treatment interventions to individuals with an alcohol problem. The team aims to help individuals manage the amount they drink, or even help them stop drinking altogether if they choose. The team will work with individuals to develop a personal plan that will support them through care and treatment. 

The service works across a range of conditions linked to alcohol dependency, from people with a serious illness caused by alcohol to people who are borderline dependent. We can help you establish the severity of your dependency and work with you to develop a care plan that is right for you. LCAS supports inpatient and community-based detoxification programmes for people requiring a medical detoxification programme. 

If you are a friend, relative or carer of someone you suspect of having an alcohol problem you can also access LCAS for free and confidential advice.
Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm
Residents of the Liverpool City Council boundary area
Self referral or via other agency

The Liverpool Community Alcohol Service provides 75 weekly community clinics across the five neighbourhood areas of Liverpool. The nature of your treatment and individual choice will determine the location of your clinic. Clinic locations include GP surgeries and community health centres. For more information, please call us on 0151 529 4504

value.SummaryText:
Harbour View Lodge is located in the town of Whitehaven and overlooks the harbour. The home is close to shops, amenities and public transport.

This tastefully decorated purpose built home provides accommodation in single occupancy rooms, all of which have en-suite facilities.

Harbour View Lodge provides TV lounges and a quiet sitting room with beautiful harbour views, for relaxation. Separate dining rooms, where residents can socialise at meal times, are also available. Meals based on traditional cooking using fresh produce are served, and residents can select from the daily choices menus available. Special diets can be catered for.

Residents can benefit from the regular visits made to the home by an experienced hair stylist and qualified chiropodist. Complementary therapies can be arranged for individuals. A sensory/relaxation room has also been developed.

The home has an activities therapist who co-ordinates a varied programme of activities for residents.

Information supplied by carehome.co.uk

value.OrganisationName: The Bridge Project - One80 – Young Persons’ Drug And Alcohol Service

Services.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
The Bridge Project is commissioned by Bradford Council to provide a comprehensive drug and alcohol service for young people up to age 21 living across the district of Bradford who are concerned about their substance misuse issues, including, but not limited to:
 
·	Alcohol
·	Cannabis 
·	Stimulants (Amphetamine/Cocaine)
·	Club Drugs and Novel Psychoactive Substances (NSP)
·	Opiates and Crack.
 
We also support family members, friends, schools, social workers, and other professionals who are concerned about a young person’s use of drugs and alcohol.
 
Our highly trained substance misuse support practitioners provide a confidential and personalised service for young people. We support young people to identify issues with drugs and alcohol and develop a tailored care plan focused on their strengths and needs, alongside risks and provide safety education around their use. Our team will work in close partnership with the young person, and anyone involved in their life. This may include family members, children’s social care, schools, youth offending team, CAMHS and wider networks of support that are important to the young person.
 
Our team is based on an outreach model, taking the service to young people in the community, providing support at a range of appropriate venues including home visits, schools, PRUs, college settings, and community centres. 
 
What we offer:  
·	Confidential support led by the young person.  
·	Comprehensive assessment including personal strengths, substance misuse issues, mental and physical health, wellbeing, safeguarding, family, and social needs.  
·	Access to wide range of online advice, information, and self-help resources.  
·	Advice, prevention, and early intervention for lower risk misuse.  
·	Structured treatment for complex needs and established patterns of use.  
·	Consultation and support for family members, friends, schools, social workers, and other professionals where consent has been given.  
·	Supported referrals to a wide range of community services for mental health, social isolation, education, peer mentoring, healthy activities, family, and relationship support.  
·	Management of treatment transition pathways for young adults.

Please telephone to check opening times of individual services as there may be slight variations but in general our core hours are:

Monday 	9.30am – 5.30pm
Tuesday 	9:30am – 7:00pm
Wednesday 	9.30am – 5.30pm
Thursday 	9.30am – 4:00pm
Friday 		9.30am – 5.30pm
Bradford District

Contact can be made by any parent, child or young person

There is also a professionals’ referral form accessed by following this link https://thebridgeproject.org.uk/professionals-referral-form/

GsdServices.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

value.OrganisationName: Aspire - Doncaster Drug And Alcohol Service

Metrics.ElementText: Aspire drug and alcohol service is a partnership between Rotherham, Doncaster and South Humber NHS Foundation Trust and The Alcohol and Drug Service (ADS). An integrated service aiming to help Doncaster people who need information, support or treatment with their substance or alcohol use. The Doncaster office is our single point of access for referral but there are other hubs available in Mexborough, Bentley and Stainforth.

Mondays and Thursdays 9am to 7pm
Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays 9am to 5pm
Doncaster
Referrals go through our single point of access service in Doncaster. Call 01302 730 956 to refer. You can also be referred by professionals; GP, nurse, social work etc.

Breakout is a specialist young person's substance misuse service covering Derby City offering confidential treatment and support for young people under 18 years of age. We can offer 1 to 1 appointments at a time and place that is suitable and safe for you.

What we offer .

- Brief harm reduction advice and information

- 1-1 Treatment interventions (including substitute medication for detox) and support

- Relapse Prevention support

- Targeted group work with vulnerable groups of young people

- Training on drug and alcohol awareness for professionals working with young people

- Support for families/carers and professionals

- Onward referral to other services for support to meet wider needs 

- Support to transition to Adult services when needed

We will do a holistic assessment of your needs and goals jointly with you to develop an individual care plan to best meet your needs after you are referred to us.
Breakout can see you at Connexions or places in your local area such as youth centres, schools or at home and we offer flexible times to suit you.
Derby City
Young people under 18 can self refer on any aspect of drug or alcohol misuse, or can ask a parent/carer or other professional to make contact on their behalf by calling us on 01332 641 661

Services.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
St Helens Young People's Drug and Alcohol Team (YPDAAT), provide young people and their families in St Helens with a range of interventions to help them to make informed choices around drug and alcohol use in order to achieve their full potential.
Despite what you might think, most young people choose not to use drugs or alcohol. Of those that do most young people will grow out of this without any issues.

What to expect
- A friendly service
- An initial appointment where we introduce ourselves and tell you more about what the team offers
- The opportunity to ask any questions and tell us a bit more about what is going on for you
- Appointments with your key worker at suitable times and places for you
- Support for as long as you feel you want to receive it
Monday - Friday 9.00am - 5.00pm (appointments can be scheduled outside of these times as needed)
St Helens MBC area

Referrals accepted from young people themselves, parents/carers, professionals
Phone: 01744 675605
Email: ypdaat@sthelens.gov.uk

value.SummaryText:
If you live in Liverpool you can be referred to one of our community drug teams; DART (Drug and Alcohol Recovery Team) or Brook Place. Where you go for treatment will depend upon your postcode:

 

DART (Drug & Alcohol Recovery Team)

Brook Place

L1, L2, L3, L5, L7, L8, L15, L16, L17, L18, L19, the parts of L20 that are within Liverpool council boundaries, L24, L25 and L27

L4, L5, L6, L9, L10 L11, L12, L13 and L14

 

You can ask your GP or other health professional to refer you or you can refer yourself by attending the team that covers your postcode.

Both teams offer the same recovery focused services which include:

  • Assessment, advice and information
  • Recovery focused approach to care planning and delivery
  • Psycho-social interventions
  • Peer mentors and support
  • Substitute prescribing
  • Community detoxification programmes and referral for inpatient treatment
  • Support and signposting to partnership agencies

value.OrganisationName: Change Grow Live Drug And Alcohol Service – Manchester, Bradnor Point

Metrics.ElementText:
Change Grow Live Manchester work with anyone looking to make positive changes related to drug & alcohol use. We approach treatment with an open mind, free from judgement. If your goals don't include treatment and recovery, but you do want to reduce the harmful impacts of drug & alcohol use, we can help with this too.  

Change Grow Live are a national organisation, with the aim to help people change the direction of their lives, grow as individuals and live life to its full potential. In Manchester, we offer support with harm reduction, needle exchange, housing, criminal justice, employment, education & training and homeless outreach. We have links with other services, including a smoking addiction service also under the Change Grow Live umbrella, called Be Smoke Free, and we offer a service which works specifically with young people, called Eclypse. We work with Emerging Futures and Acorn to deliver our psychosocial intervention groups and after-treatment care, and LGBT Foundation to provide specialist support related to LGBTQ+ issues for those in treatment. 

Change Grow Live's teams work in partnership with service users to assess their requirements and to plan individual treatment plans and support that will help service users to address their problems and achieve their personal goals.

We provide a full range of treatment and recovery interventions for people who require services for their drug or alcohol use. We do this by providing:

·	Initial assessment to work out what support will benefit you
·	Brief interventions (including harm reduction advice and support over the phone)
·	Medically assisted treatment (MAT)
·	Support sessions with recovery coordinators and engagement workers – one-to-one and in small groups
·	Second opinions when requested by a GP
·	Community detox
·	Referral for in-patient detox
·	Links to rehab clinics
·	Peer Support groups – informal drop-ins, and structured group programmes
·	Health assessments
·	Blood-borne virus (BBV) tests and treatment - HIV, Hep B and Hep C
·	Hep B & Hep C vaccinations
·	Needle Syringe Programmes (AKA needle exchange)

We also deliver free online training to professionals on topics related to drug & alcohol use, which you can find on our Eventbrite page:  https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/cc/adult-drug-alcohol-training-for-professionals-2132019
Monday to Friday, 9am – 5pm.  Some evening openings available – please ring 0161 823 6306 for details.
South Manchester

We take referrals from any source as long as they’re with the person’s consent. Clients can also self refer to the service.

Please complete online referral form:  https://www.changegrowlive.org/manchester/referrals

value.OrganisationName: East Kent Community Drug And Alcohol Service - Canterbury & Swale Hub

Services.ServiceName: Mental health services for alcohol addiction
Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText: The East Kent Community Drug and Alcohol Service is a partnership between Rapt, Rethink and Nacro. We help people who have problems with drugs and alcohol and are based in East Kent – no matter what substance or substances they use – and want support to make positive changes. Our service is delivered from five Hubs based around East Kent. Each Hub offers a service tailored to the needs of the local community - for more information, please see our website.
Monday to Friday 10-5pm

Catchment area for Caterbury - Canterbury, Whitstable and Herne Bay

Catchment area for Swale - Sheerness, Faversham and Sittingbourne.
Self-referrals for treatment can be taken via telephone on our hub number 01795411780.
Our 24/7 number is 0300 123 1186

GsdServices.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends
Mental health services for alcohol addiction

value.SummaryText:
The Harbour Hospital has access to modern equipment and private facilities for patients in Poole, Bournemouth, Dorset and the surrounding areas.

The Harbour Hospital has a recently refurbished Oncology Suite with four dedicated oncology treatment bays and 30 beds with all rooms offering the privacy and comfort of en-suite facilities, broadband, TV and telephone.

In addition, electrically operated beds have easy to reach handsets enabling patients to operate light switches and adjust bed positions at the touch of a button.

Meals are freshly prepared from our daily à la carte menu and cater for all dietary requirements.

The hospital has 3 theatres, 8 consulting rooms, a comprehensive physiotherapy department, dedicated MRI CT imaging centre and digital mammography with 24 hour inpatient doctor cover.

Some of the main private treatments offered at The Harbour Hospital in Poole include:

  • Hip surgery
  • Knee surgery
  • General surgery
  • Eye surgery
  • Cosmetic surgery

Services.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
TRI offer a variety services for individuals with severe drug or alcohol related problems across two locations. 

Services include: 
• Advice and information 
• Counselling 
• Prescribing 
• Family therapy 
• Groupwork 
• Hepatitis B vaccinations 
• Hepatitis C and HIV testing 
• Harm minimisation 
• Relapse prevention 
• Advocacy 
• Referrals to other services (including residential rehabilitation)

You can contact us via our website:  https://www.torbayandsouthdevon.nhs.uk/contact-us/contact-form/
Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm
Torbay
Self referral or via other agency.  Referrals telephone number:  01803 291129

GsdServices.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
Motiv8 is a service for young people who need help with substance misuse. 

Motiv8 can help by: 
• Supporting young people aged 17 and under who are using drugs and/or alcohol 
• Providing confidential one-to-one support sessions 
• Meeting you at a convenient place of your choice 
• Giving advice and information on drugs and alcohol and other helpful organisations 
• Providing services for pregnant young women who are using drugs and/or alcohol 
• Helping you get access to medical support 
• Advising you on how to live healthier 
• Helping young people understand the risks of taking drugs and alcohol 
• Supporting young people and act on your behalf when talking to school/college/family 
• Helping your family understand how they can help you 
• Helping you access other support services
Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm
Wiltshire County Council area
Self referral or via other agency

value.OrganisationName: Change Grow Live Drug And Alcohol Service – Manchester, Zion Centre

Services.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
Change Grow Live Manchester work with anyone looking to make positive changes related to drug & alcohol use. We approach treatment with an open mind, free from judgement. If your goals don't include treatment and recovery, but you do want to reduce the harmful impacts of drug & alcohol use, we can help with this too.  

Change Grow Live are a national organisation, with the aim to help people change the direction of their lives, grow as individuals and live life to its full potential. In Manchester, we offer support with harm reduction, needle exchange, housing, criminal justice, employment, education & training and homeless outreach. We have links with other services, including a smoking addiction service also under the Change Grow Live umbrella, called Be Smoke Free, and we offer a service which works specifically with young people, called Eclypse. We work with Emerging Futures and Acorn to deliver our psychosocial intervention groups and after-treatment care, and LGBT Foundation to provide specialist support related to LGBTQ+ issues for those in treatment. 

Change Grow Live's teams work in partnership with service users to assess their requirements and to plan individual treatment plans and support that will help service users to address their problems and achieve their personal goals.

We provide a full range of treatment and recovery interventions for people who require services for their drug or alcohol use. We do this by providing:

- Initial assessment to work out what support will benefit you
- Brief interventions (including harm reduction advice and support over the phone)
- Medically assisted treatment (MAT)
- Support sessions with recovery coordinators and engagement workers – one-to-one and in small groups
- Second opinions when requested by a GP
- Community detox
- Referral for in-patient detox
- Links to rehab clinics
- Peer Support groups – informal drop-ins, and structured group programmes
- Health assessments
- Blood-borne virus (BBV) tests and treatment - HIV, Hep B and Hep C
- Hep B & Hep C vaccinations
- Needle Syringe Programmes (AKA needle exchange)

We also deliver free online training to professionals on topics related to drug & alcohol use, which you can find on our Eventbrite page:   https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/cc/adult-drug-alcohol-training-for-professionals-2132019
Monday to Friday, 9am – 5pm. Some evening openings available – please ring 0161 823 6306 for details
Central Manchester

We take referrals from any source as long as they’re with the person’s consent. Clients can also self refer to the service.

Please complete online referral form:  https://www.changegrowlive.org/manchester/referrals

GsdServices.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

value.OrganisationName: Cgl - Children And Young People'S Drug And Alcohol Wellbeing Service

Metrics.ElementText:
The West Sussex Young Persons Substance Misuse Service offers flexible, confidential treatment and support for young people aged up to 24 years. Young people are offered appointments vie phone or video call or at a venue which suits them, such as at school or other community venue.

The support we offer
• Brief assessment and screening
• Harm reduction, advice and information
• Joint work alongside other agencies
• Holistic comprehensive assessments
• 1-1 care planned support/interventions
• Full healthcare assessments and substitute prescribing
• Relapse prevention
• Information for families, carers and significant others
• Support to transition into Adult Services when needed
• Specific targeted education with vulnerable groups
• Information and resources for professionals

The service is open Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm

Appointments can be in person at a convenient venue or over phone/video calls
West Sussex
Referrals can be made by YPs or professionals/concerned others online via our website – in addition to over the phone and by email.

value.SummaryText:
Welcome to Harbour Dental Practice, located on the outskirts of Sandbach, we are a family-orientated practice with 8 surgeries providing high quality NHS and cosmetic dentistry including:

  • Routine Examinations
  • Teeth whitening
  • Composite bonding
  • Implants
  • Invisalign
  • White fillings
  • Periodontal therapy

The practice has been established for over 80 years and has a very loyal patient base, many of whom have been seen from childhood to adulthood.

We are a busy practice but will do everything we can to accommodate none registered patients for urgent care, if we have the availability.

Dentist.Name: Only by referral from a dental practitioner
Adults entitled to free dental care

Metrics.ElementText:
Together Drug and Alcohol Service offers support to those over 18 who wish to address their drug and alcohol use. It offers:
·	Drug and alcohol support
·	Advice & information for drug and/or alcohol users or anyone concerned about someone’s use (friends, family, employers)

Services.ServiceName: Mental health services for alcohol addiction
Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText: Smithfield is a purpose built 22 bed specialist inpatient treatment unit located in Manchester City Centre. The service provides Psychosocial Interventions alongside a range of medically managed drug and alcohol detoxifications in a clinically safe and supportive environment. All treatment programmes are flexible and tailored to individual needs and outcomes to support a person’s sustained recovery from addiction.
Open 24/7
North West of England
Self referral or via other agency.

We support both men and women who have an alcohol and/or drug dependence who require in-patient care and support. We accept a wide range of service users including:Schedule 1 OffendersChaotic service users with complex needsService users with pre-existing diagnosed mental health conditions

Services.ServiceName: Mental health services for alcohol addiction

Metrics.ElementText: Better Lives we offer assessment and treatment for people with complex alcohol misuse problems. We provide individual appointments to help people reduce their drinking or achieve and maintain abstinence. We arrange out-patient and residential detoxification; referral to day programmes and to residential rehabilitation programmes. We run our own Relapse Prevention course. We offer psychology assessments and treatment and psychiatric assessment also.
Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm (Tuesday until 7pm).
Islington

Self referral or via other agency.  
Drop in referrals between 10am-12pm each day.

Metrics.ElementText:
We offer a series of structured one to one appointments with a named key worker which are designed to offer support towards goals agreed with the young person.

We use the outcome Teen Star to help develop a personalised support and recovery plan for everyone. To make sure we provide each person with the best comprehensive service we work closely with other young people services.

If a young person has a case manager in another young peoples’ service we will work closely with them to ensure a joined up package of support.
Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm
East Riding

Part of the Lambeth Drug and Alcohol Treatment Consortium, for people who need support in their ongoing recovery. Assessments for treatment are not provided at Lambeth Harbour but you can find other services that do provide initial assessments here - www.lambeth-drug-alcohol.co.uk

At this site you can access: 
• Advice and information on substance misuse

Tuesday 9.30am - 1pm

value.OrganisationName: Cgl - Bromley Drug And Alcohol Service

Metrics.ElementText:
Bromley Drug and Alcohol Service provides an integrated treatment system for adults who have a problem with drug and alcohol use. The service works with people at all points of their treatment journey from engagement into services to recovery. We also provide support services to family and carers whose lives are affected by another’s drug and alcohol use. We offer a variety of treatment services including: 

• Assessment 
• Open access 
• Outreach services 
• Opiate substitute prescribing 
• Community alcohol detoxification 
• Keyworking 
• Counselling 
• Group work 
• Job clubs 
• Peer support 
• Computer access and training 
• Ear acupuncture 
• Family and carer support 
• Criminal justice interventions including Drug Interventions Programmes (DIP) 
• Referral to residential rehab assessment 
• Needle exchange 
• Hepatitis testing and immunisation

Monday: 10am - 5pm, 
Tuesday: 10am – 8pm, 
Wednesday: 1:30pm – 5pm, 
Thursday: 10am – 5pm, 
Friday: 10am – 5pm
Bromley Borough
Self referral or via other agency

Services.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
DHI run innovative services to help disadvantaged people and those living on the margins of society turn their lives around. Our adult substance misuse services are all about helping people to make the connections that allow them to overcome their unhealthy relationship with drugs and/or alcohol.

Whether you are preparing to make changes, building your recovery or wanting to prevent relapses, we will be able to provide free and confidential help.
We pride ourselves on being rooted in the communities we work in, delivering our services in places that feel comfortable and drawing on the experiences of people who are in recovery from substance misuse.

Our integrated South Gloucestershire Drug and Alcohol Service is here to help anyone in the area who is struggling with drugs or alcohol. We mainly work out of hubs in Kingswood, Yate and Patchway, but we also work in GP surgeries and travel around the area to help people in their local communities.

If you need support with your use of drugs or alcohol, then get in touch for free and confidential help. Everyone who wants help from us will get an initial assessment. We then work with you and discuss your needs and how we can help. Our services include:
·	1:1 sessions
·	Structured group programme (including abstinence support groups and mutual aid)
·	Harm reduction advice and needle & syringe provision
·	Naloxone training and provision
·	Peer support
·	Alcohol service
·	Preparation for detox
·	Opiate substitution therapy
·	Employment, education and training (West of England Works)
·	SPACED (Stimulant, Psychoactive, Alternative, Club and Experimental Drugs) service

We also work with those who have been affected by a family member or friend's substance use through our families and carers service. We have developed a free and confidential web service that can be used by anyone. webFAM will help you assess your own needs, give you some advice and point you towards services that can help, including our family support groups. Visit https://webfam.dhi-online.org.uk/
Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm
South Gloucestershire
Self, or via other agency

GsdServices.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

value.OrganisationName: County Durham Drug And Alcohol Recovery Service - Durham

Services.ServiceName: Alcohol addiction - support for family and friends

Metrics.ElementText:
We’re geared up to help people who want to recover from addictions. After an initial assessment, you’ll get a Key Worker who’ll support you through your treatment at one of our recovery centres and help you develop a Recovery Plan, built around you and your circumstances.

We’ll provide structured one-to-one support, structured group therapy, also a health and wellbeing check including health screenings, blood testing and vaccinations.
Please contact the service for opening times.
County Durham
Please contact the service for referral details.
